11/14/2020 email (excerpt): "A few corrections regarding Ethica:
Ethica supports multiple users using the same phone, but not at the same time. A given user must log out before the next one logs in. Though this fits your definition of "Multi-user".
Ethica supports on-premises installation, though it's not publicly available. Researchers cannot download Ethica and set it up themselves (as it is with Beiwe) but they can request the service to be installed on their own server. We already have clients who use Ethica for larger projects outside North America and have installed Ethica on their local servers."

11/5/2020 email: "1. We do not officially provide an API, though we do share our API documentation with a few of our clients (it's based on REST & GraphQL)
2. To be specific about the encryption, the data is encrypted at rest, it is not end-to-end encrypted. Only our two system administrators who have direct access to our servers can access the data, and these two individuals can read any data stored on Ethica servers. You can find a lot more details in our "Ethica Software Development and Security Practices" document I shared in the previous email."

Earlier email: "You can certainly use Ethica to administer your surveys like this. In fact, we offer many more features when it comes to customization which allows you to tailor the behavior of the project based on participants' context. Also, we support push notifications, SMS, and Email notifications for all of our features. Attached is a document in which some of our features are briefly explained." https://learn.ethicadata.com/documentation/surveys/notifications/ "The in-app notification sent by Ethica is similar to the notification the participant receives if they have a new email or text message. The sound and vibration of the notification is set based on the phone's general settings. Therefore, if the phone is set to vibrate-only or silent, this notification will also behave accordingly."

ML-like apps.contact:
10/29/2020 email:

1. Where can I find a full list of features (customizing mobile questionnaires, user response options, etc.)?
See attached 1-page summary document. A few recent platform updates not captured in (Instant Messaging with Study Participants, Forthcoming Integration with ~300 wearable devices/trackers/apps)

2. How would I schedule push notifications to 1,000s of otherwise anonymous users enrolled in a study who have installed your mobile app on their phones?
This can be done using triggers. Triggers allow you to target and engage study participants base on time of day, location and activity. Here is an example of what the UI for a time-based trigger looks like:
time-based trigger.gif


3. How would I score/visualize/analyze data?
Metricwire provides tools for scoring assessments, coding & transforming data. You can export your data in CSV format or via API. 

4. How long can I keep collecting and storing data?  Are there data quotas?
You can collect data for as long as you have an active licence. There are no per participant limits on the amount of data you can collect within your licence. 

5. Would I pay for an admin license and would the 1,000s of study participants access the mobile app for free?
Correct. The mobile applications are free for study participants and a paid admin licence is needed to build and deploy studies.

6. Are data encrypted on the phone or on your servers?
Yes. We use AES-256 encryption when storing data on the mobile device and in the database. 

7. Can respondents delete data they've submitted, or can I delete respondents' data from your servers?
Respondents cannot delete their responses via the mobile application. The research team owns and controls all participant data and can delete the data at any time. Metricwire has no commercial interest in your data. 


Can you add pictures/audio/video to questions? You can add pictures/audio/video/PDF docs and embed websites
Can you do conditional/skip logic? Yes. Within/across assessments you can use conditional/skip logic. You can also trigger entirely new schedules based on response patterns. For example, If Stress > 8, deliver follow up assessments hourly for 3 hours. 
Are respondents able to record audio or draw? You can capture audio/video/images from participants. Currently no drawing capabilities but this could be incorporated. E.g. we have had recent requests for drawing on top of images (circle pain on body image).

ML-like apps.contact:
11/12/2020 email: "The offline feature will only be activated if 1) the project Maker enabled offline participation, and 2) you elected to take the project offline at the beginning (right after you entered the access code). Did you do both of those steps? Because if not, then the system will only let you complete experiences online. It operates on an online default, offline features must be turned on."

11/9/2020 email: "I was able to talk to our tech lead about the offline notifications and he said that these offline notifications operate based on an alarm clock set up where the notifications are simply synched to the phone clock. I hope this answers your question but if not, please feel free to contact our tech lead, Omar, directly at omar@expiwell.com for further clarification. He will probably be more helpful on that matter."

11/5/2020 email: "1. Is end-to-end encryption possible? Could anyone at your company access any response data?
We do not use end-to-end encryption for our response data. ExpiWell employees will be able to see the response data, but it is aggregated. The only time we are looking at specific response data is when troubleshooting. That's rare though as most issues will be located elsewhere like pulling up the participant's experience schedule.

2. Can a user receive offline (local OS) notifications as well?
Users can receive offline notifications as well. This is only if the participant has selected the project to be taken as offline. However, Android will send an offline notification if it doesn't receive the online push notification.

3. Could a researcher set up your system on their own (for example, hospital) servers, or would they have to use your SaaS?
We are a SaaS product and there is no alternative at the moment for researchers to host it elsewhere

4. So a researcher can make a deletion request, but does that mean they can select a user and hit "Delete", and these data will automatically get deleted within 8 days?
There is no option at this time to remove a participant from the project from your side at the researcher. You can delete their data in the output of course as well as delete any projects in full after downloading the data. Anything you delete on our servers will be deleted permanently from the database after 7 or 8 days. However, again, you cannot delete participant responses individually on the servers. "

11/4/2020 email: "Can a user respond by entering text, draw, write a signature, or upload files? They respond with text, audio, video, and image files. There are no signature or drawing capabilities at this time. 
Can a researcher add pictures, audio, video to accompany questions? Yes, images, audio, and video can all be integrated within the assessments.
Can a researcher add conditional logic to branch/skip questions, or add a timer/delay per question? We have logic options built in as well as skip functionality. There are no timers or delay capabilities within the survey builder right now.

Can a researcher set up scoring as they build an assessment, or would they download data and analyze offline? Yes, scoring capabilities are included in the survey builder. Happy to show this on the call.

By multi-language support, I don't mean the content of questionnaires, but the app itself, such as error messages, notifications, instructions online and in the app, etc.  I take it these are in English? Correct, the app itself is all in English right now. We are currently working on a Spanish version but do not have a release date for that yet."

11/3/2020 email: "Can I schedule push notifications to 1,000s of users multiple times per day, week, month, or on specific dates, who have installed your mobile app on their phones?  If a user taps on the push notification, will it take the user directly to the questionnaire to which they were assigned for that time? Yes, you can schedule this way in our system and have the push notification sent through mobile phones (our app is updated in both android and iOS). Correct, if the participant taps on the notification it takes them directly into the appropriate survey. No navigation through the app would be required. 
Where can I find a list of features (customizing mobile questionnaires, user response options, etc.)? A simple listing of features can be found on our pricing page here. 
How do I score/visualize/analyze data? I can show the output and dashboard of the data on our call. 
Would I pay for an admin license and would the 1,000s of study participants access the mobile app for free? Yes, you would pay for an admin license via the website or an invoice. The app is free for all users. 
Do you have a privacy policy? Yes, attached below to this email and linked here for more info. 
Are data encrypted on the phone or on your servers? Data is encrypted on our servers and am confirming with our tech team about the phones. 
Can respondents delete data they've submitted, or can I delete respondents' data from your servers? I have attached our data retention policies below as well. 
Can users respond offline? Yes, offline capabilities are included in our Premium plan and must be enabled by the researcher for participants to have that option. 
Could we set it us on our own servers? Need clarification here as to what you are looking for. 
Does it permit localization / languages? You may set the surveys in whatever language is needed. Notifications are in English. Timing of notifications are automatically set to the timezone of the participant based on their phone clock."

10/29/2020 email:

1. Can I set conditional logic for questions?

Yes, you can assign logic to questions. This works by adding an "answer rule" to the possible answers of questions. For example: if a participant answers a "yes or no" question you can decide what the following question will be based on them answering yes or no. 

2. How exactly do I schedule push notifications to 1,000s of otherwise anonymous users enrolled in a study who have installed your mobile app on their phones?

You can set the notifications per questionnaire beforehand on our platform. You can also set if or when the participant receives a notification when they didn't fill-out a questionnaire. This way you do not need to set the notifications for 1,000s participants individually. 

afbeelding.png


3. How do I score/visualize/analyze data?

You can download the data in PDF, Excel and CSV format and import the data into a programme of your choice for further analysis.

4. How long can I keep collecting and storing data?  Are there data quotas?

The duration and quotas for your study are set beforehand as part of the license you will obtain from us. Of course the duration and quotas can be upgraded if the study takes longer than foreseen.

5. Would I pay for an admin license and would the 1,000s of study participants access the mobile app for free?

Yes, use of the app is free for participants and you would pay for the admin license. 

6. Do you have a privacy policy?

Yes, we have a privacy policy. Of course we are compliant with the strict European General Data Protection Regulation and adhere to international study standards. Due to our end-to-end encryption only you have access to the filled-out questionnaires with your unique key. We at Open HealthHub cannot view the responses from the participants as they are encrypted and we do not have the decryption-key. We are ISO 27001 certifies and audited yearly.

7. Can respondents delete data they've submitted, or can I delete respondents' data from your servers?

Respondents cannot delete the data they have submitted to you. Using our platform you can of course obtain their consent before they answer questions. At the conclusion of the study we will delete all the data from the respondents from our servers. Of course you as study owner can always instruct us to delete the data from our servers at any time you want. 
PM: In case participants want their data deleted, they can have them removed by a special request as a part of the GDPR. 

[Email after registration]: "For validation we need your setup email and BIG number." 
Personal reply to an email: "The BIG-number is the official Dutch registry number for physicians, but this is of course not applicable to you. I have taken care of the “BIG number” and you should have access by now to our Improve Designer (just log in with your email and your password). In the Improve Designer you can set the notifications for the participants/patients. You can plan multiple scheduled questionnaires in the planner of the Improve Designer."

Can I schedule push notifications to 1,000s of users multiple times per day, week, month, or on specific dates, who have installed your mobile app on their phones?  Yes

How about offline notifications?: Does Beiwe deliver local operating system notifications, where an end user receives notifications in their mobile device’s notification bar at scheduled times? (This is distinct from push notifications, which require an internet connection at the time that the notification is to be received, and from simple in-app notifications, which require the end user to be using the app to see their notifications.) If a user taps on the push notification, will it take the user directly to the questionnaire to which they were assigned for that time? Yes

Yes: https://github.com/onnela-lab/beiwe/wiki/Beiwe-Data-Privacy-and-Security

We have Unicode support but all hardcoded language is exclusively in English.

11/2/2020 email: "Thank you for your Beiwe inquiry on our Google Form. I’ll provide you with some information on the Beiwe Service Center (BSC) to get the ball rolling. For BSC, we would run your study on the same production software where we run our own studies, so it’s always the latest version and we run it on our lab’s Amazon Web Services (AWS) account. To give you a snapshot of how it would work, we will set up a study for you with the passive data settings that make sense for your study and give you a login to your study on the Beiwe backend, as well as to any RAs or collaborators that you request to be added to your study (max 5 logins). From there, you can enter any survey questions if you plan to use them. The backend is also where you’ll generate “Patient IDs” for your study participants. Currently, the Beiwe app is available on the app store for Apple iOS users and on the Google Play Store for Android users. To see if Beiwe makes sense for you, please take a look at our wiki: https://github.com/onnela-lab/beiwe/wiki In particular, the sensors we support are here: https://github.com/onnela-lab/beiwe/wiki/Supported-Data-Streams Our arrangement includes having you sign an Memorandum of Understanding which provides the software “as is” and asks for your IRB protocol and approval. Currently, the Beiwe pricing is based on three things: How many study participants you plan to enroll (N) How long you collect data for each study participant (t in months) How long you expect this research to last (T in months) I.E. The time from enrollment of the first participant to finish of data collection on last enrolled study participant, this includes any additional time needed for study admin and data download."

11/3/2020 email: "Can I schedule push notifications to 1,000s of users multiple times per day, week, month, or on specific dates, who have installed your mobile app on their phones?  If a user taps on the push notification, will it take the user directly to the questionnaire to which they were assigned for that time?
Currently, scheduling is able to schedule for a certain day, so we would need to add the feature that it is on a certain time of day, but that is easy to do. Also currently you can only assign to individual users, which is not practical if you have 1000 users to send notifications to. Instead, those would need to be in a subgroup of the current user's group and then you would schedule the event for all members of a selected subgroup. 

We are working on a completely revised app for which there is an initial release in the App Store, but not yet in Google Play. That is missing the push notification feature but it will be included in a more complete release later this year, including the linking from the notification to the form to be filled.  The important feature of the new app is that it has a separate "Child UI" so you can switch between a normal UI and a UI specifically designed for illiterate users or children in general, where the answering is based on clicking on picture choices and giving audio answers. This has been developed in collaboration with Save the Children and is currently trialed in a couple of African countries with children. child UI blog"

11/5/2020 email: "previous question -- what kind of in-app notifications are possible?  Offline, local OS notifications?
Push (IOS/Android)  and in App notification shown from “site” in the chat conversation.

If you tap on a notification, does it take you directly to your scheduled questionnaire?
Today we only send questionnaire notifications as email and sms. Will be implemented in future release.

When setting up a question for an end-user, can I add pictures, an audio or video clip, a timer/countdown, conditional logic?
Conditional logic for open/closing questions etc is implemented in the ePRO system. It is possible to add pictures, but the solution can be improved.  

Do you have a consumer-facing API?
We have no API for external parties to interact with our system. We have performed proof of concept integrations with wearable technology such as the Fitbit framework and are welcoming new initiatives.

Can I assign reviewers to view particular users' data and noone else's?
A member of a site (doctor, nurse etc) can view all site participants data.   

Can more than one user access the app on a single phone?
Yes, login is with username and password. Not recommended because when you login to a phone that phone will be registered to that participant for push notifications. 
For entering data on a device used by multiple users we would recommend the web browser version of ePRO.

Can someone set up your system on their own server?
We don’t offer that service today. IT operation is performed by Complior (a group company with Replior) and is complying to security standards in PCI DSS, ISO 27001 and HIPAA

Is the study control/admin panel + end-user app (notification messages, etc.) in languages other than English?
The admin application is in English only. All participant facing information (questionnaires/info/logbooks/notifications etc ) is multi-language. System generated dialogues in the App are translated to 16 languages currently. More translations will be added upon request."

10/29/2020 email:

Question: Where can I find a full list of features (customizing mobile questionnaires, user response options, etc.)?

Answer:

You can configure features like: Title, Description, Numbering style, Completed questionarie message, Scoring, Layout type, Drop down, Single Input, Radio button grid, Simple text block etc.
 
By "text block" do you mean users read a text block or enter text?
Users read a text.

Question: How do I schedule push notifications to 1,000s of otherwise anonymous users enrolled in a study who have installed your mobile app on their phones?

Answer: First the patients have to be enrolled is the study (added to the system) and have been given access to the ePro app and the specific study. The system is a clinical trial system where each patient has a timeline that support visits, questionnaires or logbook/diary entries. The reminders/notifications are in most cases automatic based on the timeline. You also have an option to select a group of patients, or all patients, to send a message or notification to.

Anonymity in the system is ensured where phone number and e-mail are entered by the site personnel who already know the patients identity anyway.

You can configure a timeslot for questionnaire entry at a specific time window for a patient, example day 10 +/- 3 days, and then set a grace-period of for example 4 days. Reminders can be configured to be sent when the questionaries entry period start and if its not responded to go out when the grace period start.

How are these notifications/reminders sent to the participants?  By push notifications, in-app notifications, SMS, or otherwise?

Configurable to send via all methods. In-app is standard, free of charge and total anonymous. E-mail is free of charge, require e-mail address. SMS will cost an additional fee per SMS sent and require phone number.

Question: How do I score/visualize/analyze data?

Answer: Scoring is configured for the response alternatives when building the questionarie.

During the study progress is displayed in a dashboard on study, country or site level. The data can be exported in XML or CSV, for analysis in SAS or Excel.

Question: How long can I keep collecting and storing data?  Are there data quotas?

Answer: We apply a monthly fee. Data can be collected for as long as the study is in progress, and be kept on the servers for two months after Last Patient Out.

Question: Would I pay for an admin license and would the 1,000s of study participants access the mobile app for free?

Answer: You as sponsor of the study will pay a server set-up fee and a monthly software license. An additional fee per SMS sent will be applied if you select SMS messages.
The monthly fee is based on the number of questionnaires, the number of sites and number of patients. The usage of the app is included.

Question: Do you have a privacy policy?

Answer: Yes, we have. https://www.trialonline.se/privacy-policy/

Question: Are data encrypted on the phone or on your servers?

Answer: Data is encrypted on the servers, as well as the transmission via mobile phone/data network. No data is stored on the phone.

What I meant by this was: are data on the phone encrypted on the phone before they are sent to the server, so that noone at your company can see/decrypt their data?

No, the data is not encrypted on the phone.

ML-like apps.contact: "CEO of ODK here. I love emails with lots of good questions, so figured I'd take a crack at it! > 1. Could I schedule push notifications to 1,000s of otherwise anonymous users enrolled in a study who have installed your mobile app on their phones, so that they receive alerts/reminders on their phones that take them to the mobile app? Not currently, but we can build a customized version of the app to do this for your study. > 2. If I were to store data on your servers, How long can I keep storing data after my study is done?  Are there data quotas? See https://getodk.org/#odk-cloud for our very high storage quotas. If you are not capturing images/audio/video, you are unlikely to run into these quotas. You can keep the data for as long as you pay for our hosting. You can also export the data in an Excel or CSV form and store it on your own machines. > 3. Would I pay for an admin license and would the 1,000s of study participants access the mobile app for free? You can have as many users/participants/devices as you'd like for free. Are data encrypted on the phone or on your servers? Yes, data can be encrypted on the device, in transit, and at rest. See https://docs.getodk.org/central-encryption for more. > 8. Can respondents delete data they've submitted, or can I delete respondents' data from your servers? Respondents cannot delete their submissions and neither can you (although this feature is shipping soon). Part of this customization includes a guide to rebranding the app. Researchers and developers who would like to customize FDA MyStudies can rebrand it." Requires installation and maintenance of open source code. https://www.fda.gov/drugs/science-and-research-drugs/fdas-mystudies-application-app-technical-background; https://www.fda.gov/media/138258/download
Appears to be for clinicians' use
For general projects, open science; data visible by users in a project
iPad for clinician use

"Capture Data: Gather essential information from process workers directly within your work instructions. Collect data such as work order numbers, quality check values, or supervisor sign-offs — during the procedure." I don't think this means one can easily customize questions for surveys -- numbers, QC values, signatures are not the same.
Mobile app appears to just receive survey feedback; users do surveys on the web
only for passive data collection

people.definition: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).
A person 6 to 12 years of age. An individual 2 to 5 years old is CHILD, PRESCHOOL
A child between 1 and 23 months of age.
A person 13 to 18 years of age.
A person between 19 and 24 years of age.
A person having attained full growth or maturity. Adults are of 19 through 44 years of age. For a person between 19 and 24 years of age, YOUNG ADULT is available.
A person 65 through 79 years of age. For a person older than 79 years, AGED, 80 AND OVER is available.
A person 80 years of age and older.
Individuals enrolled in a school or formal educational program.
A child between the ages of 2 and 5.
Persons functioning as natural, adoptive, or substitute parents. The heading includes the concept of parenthood as well as preparation for becoming a parent.

Persons who provide care to those who need supervision or assistance in illness or disability. They may provide the care in the home, in a hospital, or in an institution. Although caregivers include trained medical, nursing, and other health personnel, the concept also refers to parents, spouses, or other family members, friends, members of the clergy, teachers, social workers, fellow patients.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
Persons who are enrolled in research studies or who are otherwise the subjects of research.
Persons or animals having at least one parent in common. (American College Dictionary, 3d ed)
Persons whom one knows, likes, and trusts.

languages.language: Central and South American Indian language

guidelines.name: NICE Guidelines
guidelines.Citation: National Collaborating Centre for Mental Health (Great Britain), National Institute for Clinical Excellence (Great Britain), British Psychological Society, & Royal College of Psychiatrists. (2004). Self-harm: The short-term physical and psychological management and secondary prevention of self-harm in primary and secondary care. British Psychological Society ; Royal College of Psychiatrists.
guidelines.description: This guideline has been developed to advise on the short-term physical and psychological management and secondary prevention of self-harm in primary and secondary care. The guideline recommendations have been developed by a multidisciplinary group of healthcare professionals, patients and their representatives, and researchers after careful consideration of the best available evidence. It is intended that the guideline will be useful to clinicians and service commissioners in providing and planning high quality care for those people who self-harm while also emphasising the importance of the experience of care for service users and carers.

guidelines.name: Australian Mental Health Triage Scale
guidelines.Citation: Smart, D., Pollard, C., & Walpole, B. (1999). Mental health triage in emergency medicine. Australian & New Zealand Journal of Psychiatry, 33(1), 57–66. https://doi.org/10.1046/j.1440-1614.1999.00515.x
guidelines.description: Objective: The aim of this study was to: (i) develop a triage scale consistent with the National Triage Scale (NTS) for patients with mental health problems attending emergency departments; and (ii) to reduce emergency waiting times, transit times and improve skills assessing mental health problems.

guidelines.name: The Australasian Triage Scale (ATS)
guidelines.Citation: Considine, J., LeVasseur, S. A., & Villanueva, E. (2004). The Australasian Triage Scale: Examining emergency department nurses’ performance using computer and paper scenarios. Annals of Emergency Medicine, 44(5), 516–523. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.annemergmed.2004.04.007

guidelines.name: The Victorian Emergency Department Mental Health Triage Tool
guidelines.Citation: Huckson, S. (2008). Implementation of the Victorian Emergency Department Mental Health Triage Tool. Australasian Emergency Nursing Journal, 11(2), 80–84. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aenj.2008.02.007
